result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary D Klopstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Klopstein to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp."
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

superMiscConds.notes:
--  Child Pornography Image surcharge applies to 13 images.
--  To pay costs of $268;  $99 subpoena fee and $250 DNA surcharge.
--  Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent.

--  Sex offender assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
--  Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent.

--  Sex offender supervision per the Department of Corrections including, among other conditions: No use of the Internet or like technology/communications without agent authorization. Not be alone with any minor child.  No physical contact with any minor child except as is allowed by the Agent. No presence at any facility such as parks, playgrounds, carnivals, waterparks or similar facilities where children are known to gather.
--  To comply with DNA sample provision upon demand.

[MK] case called at 2:12pm. 
Defendant Gary D Klopstein appears via videoconferencing from New Lisbon Correctional Institution, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments on Mr. Klopstein's Petition for Sentence Adjustment are given by ADA Hall and by Mr. Klopstein.
The Court finds that it is in the best interests of the public and to Mr. Klopstein for him to be released to Supervision. The Court signs the Order to adjust Mr. Klopstein's sentence. The Court clarifies that the Department has up to sixty days to effectuate the Court's Order.
recess 2:16pm.
Sentence adjustment review on December 3, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
DA's response on Petition for Sentence Adjustment

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:06am [mo and CRHI]
Defendant Gary D Klopstein in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court verifies receipt and review of letters submitted by Atty. Fischer on behalf of Mr. Klopstein.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
--Statements made by J.B.; J.K.; K.W. and J.K.

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Fischer.
Statement made by Mr. Klopstein.

The Court sentences Mr. Klopstein to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp."
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--  Sex offender assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
--  Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent.
--  Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent.
--  Sex offender supervision per the Department of Corrections including, among other conditions: No use of the Internet or like technology/communications without agent authorization. Not be alone with any minor child.  No physical contact with any minor child except as is allowed by the Agent. No presence at any facility such as parks, playgrounds, carnivals, waterparks or similar facilities where children are known to gather.
--  To comply with DNA sample provision upon demand.
--  Child Pornography Image surcharge applies to 13 images.
--  To pay costs of $268;  $99 subpoena fee and $250 DNA surcharge.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given.
Statute 948.13 prohibition from employment or volunteer-work that involves children is imposed; penalties recited.
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited.
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant.
Recess 10:22am
Court's review of Attorney Fischer's 5-12-2016 filing
Letters from Attorney Fischer enclosing letters in support of Defendant
Sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 11:49 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer: Surprised at non-appearance. Have been in regular contact with Mr. Klopstein. Was going to be a joint recommendation for adjournment today, presents basis including missing forensic disc. ADA Hall does not have the disc as well. Disc does detail the entirity of examination done. Would request to produce Mr. Klopstein in the next few days to avoid warrant. 
ADA Hall: Agree with comments of Atty Fischer - adjournment is needed. Have already contacted Agent. Also surprised not to see defendant, no objection to staying warrant.
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that there are known victims, but none have responded
Court grants adjournment of trial and informs Counsel to talk with Court's JA to schedule new trial date - new date to be scheduled no later than 4:00 pm on 8/17/15
Court orders that disc to be in the hands of Atty Fischer no later than 4:00 pm on Monday, September 7th
Court orders issuance of bench warrant for Mr. Klopstein - Court STAYS warrant until 8/4/15 at 3:30 pm - As long as Atty Fischer contacts the Court and informs the Court that Mr. Klopstein has appeared in person for the meeting with Attorney Fischer tomorrow, the warrant can be canceled.
Recess: 12:00 pm 

NEXT:  Reschedule Trial date - Counsel to contact Court's JA no later than 4:00 on 8/17/15

Case called at 8:30am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Gary D Klopstein in court with attorney Michael C. Witt.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense moves for witness sequestration; so ordered by the Court with an exception for Det. Ungerer as the Court Officer named by the State; presents basis. 

Mark A. Robel sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Hall
-  States Exh. #1  FBI Consent to Interview witholygraph (2 pgs.) - Offered and Received
-  Examination by the Court
-  Cross examination by Atty. Witt
-  Redirect examination by ADA Hall
-  Recross examination by Atty. Witt

Brant Ungerer sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Hall
-  Examination by the Court
-  Cross examination by Atty. Witt
-  Redirect examination by ADA Hall
-  Recross examination by Atty. Witt

State rests. 
Arguments presented by Counsel. 
State moves to re-open the evidence and to allow additional evidence from Agent Ungerer.
Defense opposes the motion; presents basis. 
Court grants the motion to re-open the evidence and re-call Agent Ungerer. 

Brant Ungerer recalled and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Hall 
-  Cross examination by Atty. Witt

Evidence closed. 
Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Recess 10:25am; Recalled 11:03am

Court reviews applicable case law. Court presents basis for findings and orders. 
Court denies the motion to suppress; presents basis including both on the basis that the statements were voluntary and because the statements were not taken in violation of Miranda. 

Defense requests clarification as it relates to the first statements at the residence. 
Court finds and clarifies that the officers were there to execute a search warrant and not to arrest and therefore the defendant was detained but not arrested and therefore the first statements will all be allowed. 

Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for:
PTC  2/18/15 at 9:40am
Status  2/24/15 at 9:30am

NEXT  Notices to be mailed
PTC  2/18/15 at 9:40am
Status  2/24/15 at 9:30am
Miranda/Goodchild Hearing on January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Miranda/Goodchild Hearing on January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

case called at 2:09pm. [MK]
Defendant Gary D Klopstein in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Ungerer is present as the State's witness. 

This case is scheduled for Miranda-Goodchild Hearing today. 
The State now realizes that it has arranged for only one witness to testify today; there is a second interview statement that was taken by a different officer, so the State can proceed with the testimony of Agent Ungerer now, however it is not prepared to conclude its presentation of evidence today. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling, including that the case will transfer to Branch III/Judge Wambach by the January 1st Judicial Rotation. 
Attorney Witt is not opposing adjournment of the hearing, but indicates that he would agree to this Court hearing the the matter today and then keeping the case so that can begin the hearing today and then hear the second part on a later date. 
The Court refers the matter to Branch III for rescheduling of the hearing. 
Mr. Klopstein verifies that the 109 1/2 N. 9th Street address remains current. 
recess 2:14pm. 

NEXT:  the case is referred to Branch III for the rescheduling of the Miranda/Goodchild Hearing (allow 3 hours)
FINANCIAL NOTES: $75.00 Attorney fee payment received via gps.

case called at 9:17am. 
Defendant Gary D Klopstein in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Detective Brant Ungerer- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Witt
--redirect examination by ADA Hall 
--recross examination by Attorney Witt
--re-redirect examination by ADA Hall 
--examination by the Court

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Klopstein committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
ADA Hall files the Information. 
Attorney Witt alerts the Court that he is researching  St.973.04(2)(2) as applicable to St.948.12 & St.948.05 and he anticipates raising a challenge regarding muliplicity and/or duplicity issies.  Attorney Witt also intends to file a Miranda-Goodchild Motion. 
The Court requires the Defense Motions are to be filed by 9/5/14 
Attorney Witt indicates that Mr. Klopstein has not had any change of address.
recess 10:08am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:39am. 
Defendant Gary D Klopstein in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
After a discussion with counsel, the Court denies the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, finding that the Third Amended Criminal Complaint has resolved the issues raised in the Motion. 
Service of Third Amended Criminal Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties., however Attorney Witt

The Court requires a $50,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to use the Internet except at employment during employment hours and for employment purposes only, and for online banking purposes which may occur at home
--no contact with any females under the age of 18 except for supervised contact by an appropriate adult, and except for incidental contact
--no presence at places where children typically gather such as parks, playgrounds, fairs, carnivals, etc
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 10:53am. 

NEXT:  schedule Preliminary Hearing on 8/25/14 at 8:30am. (allow 1/2 hour)
